tweets.text: RT @bespokeinvest: The cumulative A/D line for the Consumer Discretionary sector has been flying.  Tesla $TSLA and Amazon $AMZN have held b…

Six of eleven sectors are now overbought, or more than one standard deviation above their 50-DMAs.  Real Estate, Communication Services and Industrials are the most extended.  

Health Care and Energy are the two sectors just slightly below their 50-DMAs.

https://t.co/e8LECQTizl https://t.co/F6KNQFuP6n

The cumulative A/D line for the Consumer Discretionary sector has been flying.  Tesla $TSLA and Amazon $AMZN have held back the sector on a cap weighted basis, but the equalweight ETF $RCD is close to a six-month high.

https://t.co/H4p1RcpNxV https://t.co/roZx63t70i

2022's two biggest losers in the Dow (CRM, INTC) have bounced the most in 2023.  The 8 Dow stocks that are currently down YTD were up an average of 10.4% in 2022.  The 9 Dow stocks up 5%+ so far in 2023 were down an average of 25.8% in 2022.

https://t.co/H4p1RcpfIn https://t.co/dmcwyxsWCE
RT @bespokeinvest: Two years ago at the end of 2020, the S&P’s dividend yield was higher than the entire Treasury curve except for the 30-y…

The first issuance out of the US Treasury is slated for this week with a combined $90 billion of 3s, 10s, and 30s to hit the tape. 10 year notes have been particularly weak recently.

Read more in tonight's Closer: https://t.co/4gKt2cTweb https://t.co/1mZqbXY2SA

It was nice to see the S&P 500 break out of what had been a two-week very tight trading range- and not break out to the downside! But the S&P still remains below its 50-DMA. https://t.co/N6htZICM4t https://t.co/F9gj7uBooM

Two years ago at the end of 2020, the S&P’s dividend yield was higher than the entire Treasury curve except for the 30-year.  Fast forward to now and the S&P’s dividend looks puny compared to 4%+ yields on T-Bills.  Two simple charts:

https://t.co/NkzE9b5Ip4 https://t.co/HCCct9eCw6

Here's an interesting long-term chart showing the ratio of the Nasdaq 100 vs. the energy sector.  Note the long period between 2003 and 2018 bookended by two huge spikes and drops.
